input: For the dressing, combine/whisk garlic, Dijon mustard and balsamic vinegar in a small bowl to combine., Using a small whisk gradually add in the oil, beating until well blended., Add in the Italian seasoning, salt and pepper., In a large bowl, combine lettuce, turkey, proscuitto, cubed cheese, garbonzo beans, cherry tomato halves, olives and sliced onions., Pour enough dressing over as desired; toss to combine., Season salad with salt and pepper to taste., Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese if desired and serve.
target: fresh garlic, mustard, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, dryed italian seasoning, salt, head lettuce, turkey, ham, swiss cheese, garbanzo beans, tomatoes, olives, parmesan cheese, red onion, salt

input: Spread cream cheese onto bottom of microwaveable small dish or 9 inch pie plate., Sprinkle with cheddar cheese, ham and parmesan cheese., Microwave on high 1 minute or until heated through., Spread the top with bell peppers, onions and ground pepper, sprinkling each topping in a row over 1/3 of spread., Serve with crackers., *substitutes* You can also use chopped roasted red peppers, sliced jalapeno peppers or salsa in place of red bell peppers*.
target: cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, cream cheese, red bell peppers, green onions, ground cayenne pepper, ham, crackers

input: Preheat oven to 350 F., In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp. olive oil and saute carrots, shallots and fennel., Add pink peppercorns, 3 teaspoons violet jam and salt. Stir., Cook until tender but still crunchy., Meanwhile, place fish on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper., Drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper., Bake for about 25 minutes until cooked through., Serve fish on top with sauteed vegetables and garnish with remaining violet jam.
target: carrot, shallot, fennel, olive oil, peppercorns, salt
